data.title: Department Store (1935)
data.meta_description: The heir to a London department store must learn the business, but he must start off by working his way through the various menial jobs incognito first. However, a crooked manager has arranged, for a cracksman, just out of prison, to join the staff. Each is mistaken for the other.
data.text:
Leslie S. Hiscott’s British crime comedy drama in which two young men from different walks of life, start work in the same department store. Starring Geraldine Fitzgerald, Eve Gray and Garry Marsh.

The successor to a London department store has to learn the business, but he is forced to begin by working his way through the number of menial occupations incognito first. However, a criminal boss has organised, for a cracksman, to join the staff. Each is misguided for the other.

Garry Marsh and Sebastian Shaw both give okay performances in their respective roles as Timothy Bradbury and John Goodman Johnson, the two very different men involved, while Geraldine Fitzgerald and Eve Gray don’t offer much in their respective parts…
